meanings.definition: A tube or lip projecting from a container, through which liquid can be poured or discharged.
meanings.sent1: The teapot's spout allowed the tea to flow smoothly.
meanings.sent2: She carefully poured the milk from the spout of the jug.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten tried to drink from the spout of the watering can.
meanings.sent4: The fountain's spout danced in the sunlight, creating a beautiful display.
meanings.sent5: The spout of the watering can glistened with droplets of water.

meanings.definition: To emit or discharge in a stream or jet.
meanings.sent1: The whale spouts water from its blowhole.
meanings.sent2: The old pipe spouts water when the pressure is too high.
meanings.sent3: The cartoon character spouts bubbles instead of words when surprised.
meanings.sent4: The geyser spouts hot water high into the air.
meanings.sent5: The tea kettle spouts steam when it's boiling.

meanings.definition: A projecting nozzle or lip from which a liquid can be poured.
meanings.sent1: The oil can's spout was designed for easy pouring.
meanings.sent2: She used the spout of the watering can to water her plants.
meanings.sent3: The chocolate fountain's spout tempted everyone at the party.
meanings.sent4: The teapot's spout elegantly poured the hot tea into the cups.
meanings.sent5: The spout of the watering can was clogged with dirt.
